function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Failure to specify responsible agencies and mechanisms for collaboration and funding","category":"Accountability","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Vector-borne diseases transmitted by multiple species of vectors","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Unplanned urbanization leading to proliferation of slums and inadequate sanitation, leading to increased vector-borne disease transmission","category":"Organizations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased house infestations of triatomine bugs due to simple improvements in public streetlights","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Electric pumps as a risk factor for schistosomiasis spread in brazil","category":"Organizations","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Proliferation of aedes aegypti and aedes albopictus in urban areas leading to spread of dengue fever, zika, and chikungunya","category":"Person","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spread of chagas disease in urban areas influenced by housing quality and land tenure security","category":"Organizations","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Dependence on foreign aid and outside experts","category":"Organizations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Neglecting local community adaptations in epidemic contexts","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Vulnerability as the level of exposure and sensitivity to vbds minus adaptive capacity","category":"Leadership","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Poverty increases vulnerability to vector-borne diseases vbds by limiting people’s ability to cope with health risks.","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Complex interplay of social, cultural, economic, and environmental factors contributes to vulnerability to vbds.","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Difficulty in standardizing metrics for measuring vulnerability to vbds across different contexts.","category":"Participation","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited access to social services and resources","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inequitable health governance and access to diagnosis, treatment, and prevention","category":"Organizations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of community ownership of natural resources","category":"Leadership","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Constraints to human agency and social ecology","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate translation of rhetoric into practice","category":"Participation","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of emphasis on hygiene and sanitation in community-based adaptation initiatives","category":"Persons","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Inadequate healthcare access for community members in rural areas","category":"Organizations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited communication and coordination between community-based adaptation projects and public health initiatives","category":"Family","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of integrating strong and holistic ecosystem perspectives","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Challenges in fostering sustainable transformations in the absence of addressing overarching socio-economic structural conditions","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Relative policy neglect for large-scale implementation of participatory approaches","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unwillingness of mainstream medical establishment to engage with community-based approaches","category":"Participation","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Issue of scale in community-based projects","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unclear scalability of community-based approaches","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of community-based studies for mitigating the effects of climate change on vbds","category":"Persons","confidence":"Low"}]}
